title: Lyminge Forest Walk Route

images.title: Nick Smith / Feature on Lyminge church
images.caption: Feature on Lyminge church, originally founded in 633. The current church building dates back to c. 965, with additions dating to the late 12th century, the 14th century, and the early 16th century, and is a Grade I listed building.

images.title: Nick Smith / Wooden bridge over the Nailbourne
images.caption: Wooden bridge over the Nailbourne. Wooden bridge over the Nailbourne Linking the main grassed play area of Tayne field with the smaller area containing a play park.

images.title: Nick Smith / View along High Street, Elham
images.caption: View along High Street, Elham

images.title: Etchinghill Crossroads by Oast House Archive, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Etchinghill Crossroads

description: This Kent based village is located just north of the coast, near Folkestone. It's a nice place for a walk with waterside trails, local woods and some lovely North Downs scenery to enjoy. There's also a fine local pub and a noteworthy church which dates back to the mid 10th century. This circular walk from the village uses sections of the Elham Valley Way and the North Downs Way to visit the neighbouring villages of Elham and Etchinghill. You'll also explore the expansive West Woods which is located just north west of the village. Along the way there's views of the Nailbourne stream and the surrounding North Downs countryside. To extend the walk head south east to visit Peene Quarry Country Park. There's some wonderful views to the coast from the elevated position of the old quarry.
